headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 78 (75b 7x4 1x6 117m) SR: 104

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken superbly by Gurbaz! Back of a length delivery slanted across the batter outside off stump. Mendis flashes his blade at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies towards the keeper. Gurbaz flings out his right mitt and plucks it out of thin air! Huge wicket in the context of this game but take nothing away from the knock - it has set Sri Lanka up for a score, most probably, in excess of 300!

images.caption: Kusal Mendis celebrates his fifty
images.longCaption: Kusal Mendis celebrates his fifty, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne lbw b Noor Ahmad 52 (62b 7x4 0x6 99m) SR: 83.87

dismissalComment.html: And now Dimuth must go! This one is flatter and keeps a bit low off a good length, Dimuth goes back in his crease and looks to work this off middle and leg, but the ball fizzes through and traps him plumb in front. Umpire Hannibal thinks about it and eventually raises the finger. Dimuth wisely opts against the review, that was dead on.

images.caption: Noor Ahmad celebrates after trapping Dimuth Karunaratne lbw
images.longCaption: Noor Ahmad celebrates after trapping Dimuth Karunaratne lbw, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

image.caption: Pathum Nissanka portrait
image.longCaption: Pathum Nissanka portrait, Antigua and Barbuda, March 12, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: big appeal, not given! Flat and full on middle and off stump. Nissanka is caught on the crease and has a hurried prod at it. He seems to get some bat on it but has the ball hit the pad first? Afghanistan think that is the case and they review! The ball is very close to the bat but the umpire needs UltraEdge to confirm. Okay, looks like the bat has hit the back pad, but not before the ball has hit the back pad. Three reds on Ball Tracking, and Nissanka has to go!

headshotImage.caption: Charith Asalanka, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Charith Asalanka, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal and that looks very adjacent! Quicker and more round-arm on a length on middle and off stump. Asalanka, like Karunaratne and Nissanka, is caught on the crease and is late in bringing his bat down. The ball skids and pings him on the back pad, right in front of the stumps. The umpire raises his finger and Asalanka does not even bother with the review! Afghanistan are chipping away at the wickets!

dismissalText.commentary: Sadeera Samarawickrama b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 44 (46b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 95.65

dismissalComment.html: knocks him over! Slightly quicker and flatter on a length at the stumps. Samarawickrama hangs back and tries to smash it into next week. He is a touch late on the stroke, though, and gets a bottom edge that pings off his back thigh and into off stump! Massive wicket for Afghanistan!

headshotImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi lbw b DM de Silva 57 (62b 6x4 0x6 77m) SR: 91.93

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and the umpire raises his finger! The wheels are coming off for Afghanistan now! Length delivery on off stump that continues with the angle and goes straight on. Shahidi plays down the wrong line as the ball sneaks past the inside edge and pins him on the back leg. Shahidi reviews but it could be more in hope that expectation. No bat involved and Bal Tracking reckons the ball would have crashed into middle and leg stump! Afghanistan are six down now!

dismissalText.long: c Mendis b DM de Silva
dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c Mendis b DM de Silva 54 (75b 2x4 2x6 123m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: Edged and Ibrahim must go! DDS persists with around the wicket to Ibrahim and it pays off. This was a length ball fired across the right hander. Ibrahim looks for the cut but gets a thick edge, which Mendis does exceedingly well to hold on to. That is a big strike for Sri Lanka.

dismissalComment.html: Holes out in the deep! The scoreboard pressure begins to tell. Najibullah looks to up the scoring rate and charges DDS. He gets hold of this lofted off drive but doesn't quite get enough to clear the man on the long-off boundary

headshotImage.caption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: cleans him up with a wrong'un! Googly on a length on middle and off stump. Noor sits back in his crease and tries to pull it away. The problem, though, is that he has not picked the googly. The ball sneaks past his flailing blade, kisses the back thigh and then crashes into leg stump!

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal and this time, the umpire raises his finger! A very similar delivery to the previous one, although this might have been a little fuller. Mujeeb is again trapped on the crease and plays all over it as the ball thuds into the pads. Mujeeb reviews but this looked very close on first glance. No bat involved and Ball Tracking shows that the ball would have just grazed the outside of leg stump! Umpire's Call and Mujeeb has to go!

headshotImage.caption: Fareed Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fareed Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: knocks him over with a ripper! Flighted beautifully on a length just outside off stump. The ball dips devilishly too and Fareed, trying to fence at it, gets nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. Leaves a gap between bat and pad and the ball goes through it comfortably before smashing into the stumps!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah lbw b Shanaka 36 (42b 3x4 0x6 50m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: Shanaka traps Rahmat lbw! Full and angled into the stumps. Rahmat does not get a good stride forward and then plays all over a straight delivery. It pins him on the back leg and the umpire has no hesitation in raising his finger. Rahmat consults with his partner and then reviews. If there is no bat involved, this could be curtains. No bat and Ball Tracking says that the ball would have just clipped the outside of leg stump! Umpire's Call and Rahmat has to go!

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and the umpire raises his finger! The wheels are coming off for Afghanistan now! Length delivery on off stump that continues with the angle and goes straight on. Shahidi plays down the wrong line as the ball sneaks past the inside edge and pins him on the back leg. Shahidi reviews but it could be more in hope that expectation. No bat involved and Bal Tracking reckons the ball would have crashed into middle and leg stump! Afghanistan are six down now!

commentTextItems.html: Sri Lanka win by 132 runs! Full delivery outside off stump that pitches and moves away. Omarzai is trying to smash this into the ocean but loses his shape completely. He slices it off the outer half of the bat and long off settles under it, completing the catch with the minimal of fuss!

commentPostTextItems.html: 5:54pm Right. That will be that from us for this game. In a couple of days' time, these teams will be at it again - this time, with the series on the line. Do join us then too. Until next time, this is me (Shashwat) signing off on behalf of Madushka, Sudeep and everyone else at ESPNcricinfo! Goodbye and take care!

Dasun Shanaka, Sri Lanka captain: (Difference between this game and the first ODI) To be honest, our approach was the same. To play with positive intent is the main goal. The wicket today was better - the ball was not swinging and it was coming onto the bat. We knew with the partnerships we had, we were going to score big today. Toss is important as well but at the end of the day, the toss does not define whether we would win or lose. It is the skills that make it happen. (On batting in the death overs) We did not play on these type of pitches - here, it is different, so, credit must go to the ground staff as well. Our top four fired today and this is the way we should bat. Wanindu and myself ended well. (On Chameera) He is bowling with that intent and he has the skills to play white-ball cricket, and that is what is most important. At any time, we should have a player like that in our team. (On possible changes for the last ODI) It is totally up to the selectors, the coach and myself. We need to win the series before going into the qualifiers. We are trying different things and we are yet to decide (on the combination).

Hashmatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan captain: (What went wrong) Our fielding and the way we bowled the last few overs. It sometimes happens. Everyone is trying their best but sometimes, it does not go according to the plan. The batting line-up is improving day by day and we will try to come back stronger. (On the toss) I think the pitch was not very difficult in the second innings also. 30 extra runs that Sri Lanka made against us meant that the pressure was on us and that was the main point. Hopefully we will have him (Rashid Khan) available in the next match.

Dhananjaya de Silva, Player of the Match: (On his role) Last series we played in Sri Lanka, I was batting up the order. I am enjoying (this new role). When I am bowling, my role is to support Wanindu and Maheesh and to keep the batters under pressure. (On the pitch) It is getting slower and slower.
Stick around as we bring the post-match presentation to you in a short while!

5:34pm Well, that turned into a fairly one-sided contest in the end - Sri Lanka's biggest over Afghanistan in ODIs (in terms of runs). They set the tone with the ball in the powerplay, with Chameera accounting for Gurbaz early. Afghanistan could never really get going and once the required run-rate zinged up to more than eight runs per over, they were always playing catch-up. The hosts' spinners also came into their own in the middle overs. de Silva bagged three, while Hasaranga also popped up with a three-wicket haul. In short, this was the sort of display Sri Lanka needed, especially after losing the opening game convincingly.

As for Afghanistan, this was a bad day at the office overall. Their bowing was not quite up to scratch and they struggled for rhythm with the bat. Skipper Shahidi was the only batter who looked comfortable at the crease and while Ibrahim Zadran also notched up a fifty, he was not at his free-flowing best. The visitors now have a couple of days to reflect on this loss, pick themselves up and ready themselves for the decider on Wednesday.

dismissalText.commentary: Pathum Nissanka lbw b Mohammad Nabi 43 (56b 6x4 0x6 73m) SR: 76.78

dismissalComment.html: big appeal, not given! Flat and full on middle and off stump. Nissanka is caught on the crease and has a hurried prod at it. He seems to get some bat on it but has the ball hit the pad first? Afghanistan think that is the case and they review! The ball is very close to the bat but the umpire needs UltraEdge to confirm. Okay, looks like the bat has hit the back pad, but not before the ball has hit the back pad. Three reds on Ball Tracking, and Nissanka has to go!

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 78 (75b 7x4 1x6 117m) SR: 104

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken superbly by Gurbaz! Back of a length delivery slanted across the batter outside off stump. Mendis flashes his blade at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies towards the keeper. Gurbaz flings out his right mitt and plucks it out of thin air! Huge wicket in the context of this game but take nothing away from the knock - it has set Sri Lanka up for a score, most probably, in excess of 300!

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Pathum Nissanka lbw b Mohammad Nabi 43 (56b 6x4 0x6 73m) SR: 76.78

dismissalComment.html: big appeal, not given! Flat and full on middle and off stump. Nissanka is caught on the crease and has a hurried prod at it. He seems to get some bat on it but has the ball hit the pad first? Afghanistan think that is the case and they review! The ball is very close to the bat but the umpire needs UltraEdge to confirm. Okay, looks like the bat has hit the back pad, but not before the ball has hit the back pad. Three reds on Ball Tracking, and Nissanka has to go!

images.caption: Mohammad Nabi trapped Pathum Nissanka lbw for 43
images.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi trapped Pathum Nissanka lbw for 43, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ahmad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne lbw b Noor Ahmad 52 (62b 7x4 0x6 99m) SR: 83.87

dismissalComment.html: And now Dimuth must go! This one is flatter and keeps a bit low off a good length, Dimuth goes back in his crease and looks to work this off middle and leg, but the ball fizzes through and traps him plumb in front. Umpire Hannibal thinks about it and eventually raises the finger. Dimuth wisely opts against the review, that was dead on.

images.caption: Noor Ahmad celebrates after trapping Dimuth Karunaratne lbw
images.longCaption: Noor Ahmad celebrates after trapping Dimuth Karunaratne lbw, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Sadeera Samarawickrama b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 44 (46b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 95.65

dismissalComment.html: knocks him over! Slightly quicker and flatter on a length at the stumps. Samarawickrama hangs back and tries to smash it into next week. He is a touch late on the stroke, though, and gets a bottom edge that pings off his back thigh and into off stump! Massive wicket for Afghanistan!

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Charith Asalanka lbw b Mohammad Nabi 6 (12b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal and that looks very adjacent! Quicker and more round-arm on a length on middle and off stump. Asalanka, like Karunaratne and Nissanka, is caught on the crease and is late in bringing his bat down. The ball skids and pings him on the back pad, right in front of the stumps. The umpire raises his finger and Asalanka does not even bother with the review! Afghanistan are chipping away at the wickets!

images.caption: Mohammad Nabi finished with figures of 2 for 52
images.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi finished with figures of 2 for 52, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

dismissalText.long: c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 78 (75b 7x4 1x6 117m) SR: 104

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken superbly by Gurbaz! Back of a length delivery slanted across the batter outside off stump. Mendis flashes his blade at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies towards the keeper. Gurbaz flings out his right mitt and plucks it out of thin air! Huge wicket in the context of this game but take nothing away from the knock - it has set Sri Lanka up for a score, most probably, in excess of 300!

images.caption: Kusal Mendis celebrates his fifty
images.longCaption: Kusal Mendis celebrates his fifty, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Dasun Shanaka c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 23 (13b 2x4 1x6 19m) SR: 176.92

dismissalComment.html: Shanaka bites the dust! Back of a length delivery on middle and leg stump. Shanaka tries to manufacture room and tries to glide it past the keeper. He is cramped for room, though, and in the end, he only offers some simple catching practice to Gurbaz behind the stumps!

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c Mendis b DM de Silva 54 (75b 2x4 2x6 123m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: Edged and Ibrahim must go! DDS persists with around the wicket to Ibrahim and it pays off. This was a length ball fired across the right hander. Ibrahim looks for the cut but gets a thick edge, which Mendis does exceedingly well to hold on to. That is a big strike for Sri Lanka.

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah lbw b Shanaka 36 (42b 3x4 0x6 50m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: Shanaka traps Rahmat lbw! Full and angled into the stumps. Rahmat does not get a good stride forward and then plays all over a straight delivery. It pins him on the back leg and the umpire has no hesitation in raising his finger. Rahmat consults with his partner and then reviews. If there is no bat involved, this could be curtains. No bat and Ball Tracking says that the ball would have just clipped the outside of leg stump! Umpire's Call and Rahmat has to go!

images.caption: Dasun Shanaka trapped Rahmat Shah in front
images.longCaption: Dasun Shanaka trapped Rahmat Shah in front, Sri Lanka vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Hambantota, June 4, 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi lbw b DM de Silva 57 (62b 6x4 0x6 77m) SR: 91.93

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and the umpire raises his finger! The wheels are coming off for Afghanistan now! Length delivery on off stump that continues with the angle and goes straight on. Shahidi plays down the wrong line as the ball sneaks past the inside edge and pins him on the back leg. Shahidi reviews but it could be more in hope that expectation. No bat involved and Bal Tracking reckons the ball would have crashed into middle and leg stump! Afghanistan are six down now!

dismissalText.commentary: Azmatullah Omarzai c Shanaka b Theekshana 28 (31b 4x4 1x6 36m) SR: 90.32

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka win by 132 runs! Full delivery outside off stump that pitches and moves away. Omarzai is trying to smash this into the ocean but loses his shape completely. He slices it off the outer half of the bat and long off settles under it, completing the catch with the minimal of fuss!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah lbw b Shanaka 36 (42b 3x4 0x6 50m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: Shanaka traps Rahmat lbw! Full and angled into the stumps. Rahmat does not get a good stride forward and then plays all over a straight delivery. It pins him on the back leg and the umpire has no hesitation in raising his finger. Rahmat consults with his partner and then reviews. If there is no bat involved, this could be curtains. No bat and Ball Tracking says that the ball would have just clipped the outside of leg stump! Umpire's Call and Rahmat has to go!

dismissalText.long: c Mendis b DM de Silva
dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c Mendis b DM de Silva 54 (75b 2x4 2x6 123m) SR: 72

dismissalComment.html: Edged and Ibrahim must go! DDS persists with around the wicket to Ibrahim and it pays off. This was a length ball fired across the right hander. Ibrahim looks for the cut but gets a thick edge, which Mendis does exceedingly well to hold on to. That is a big strike for Sri Lanka.

dismissalComment.html: Holes out in the deep! The scoreboard pressure begins to tell. Najibullah looks to up the scoring rate and charges DDS. He gets hold of this lofted off drive but doesn't quite get enough to clear the man on the long-off boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Mendis b Chameera 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Chameera has another! Similar length delivery in the corridor that pitches and seems to nip away ever so slightly. Nabi, without any foot movement and with an open bat face, has a poke at it and gets a healthy nick that Mendis gobbles up behind the stumps!

headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi lbw b DM de Silva 57 (62b 6x4 0x6 77m) SR: 91.93

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal, and the umpire raises his finger! The wheels are coming off for Afghanistan now! Length delivery on off stump that continues with the angle and goes straight on. Shahidi plays down the wrong line as the ball sneaks past the inside edge and pins him on the back leg. Shahidi reviews but it could be more in hope that expectation. No bat involved and Bal Tracking reckons the ball would have crashed into middle and leg stump! Afghanistan are six down now!

headshotImage.longCaption: Wanindu Hasaranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ahmad b PWH de Silva 3 (7b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: cleans him up with a wrong'un! Googly on a length on middle and off stump. Noor sits back in his crease and tries to pull it away. The problem, though, is that he has not picked the googly. The ball sneaks past his flailing blade, kisses the back thigh and then crashes into leg stump!

dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman lbw b PWH de Silva 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: huge appeal and this time, the umpire raises his finger! A very similar delivery to the previous one, although this might have been a little fuller. Mujeeb is again trapped on the crease and plays all over it as the ball thuds into the pads. Mujeeb reviews but this looked very close on first glance. No bat involved and Ball Tracking shows that the ball would have just grazed the outside of leg stump! Umpire's Call and Mujeeb has to go!

dismissalText.commentary: Fareed Ahmad b PWH de Silva 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: knocks him over with a ripper! Flighted beautifully on a length just outside off stump. The ball dips devilishly too and Fareed, trying to fence at it, gets nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. Leaves a gap between bat and pad and the ball goes through it comfortably before smashing into the stumps!

dismissalText.commentary: Azmatullah Omarzai c Shanaka b Theekshana 28 (31b 4x4 1x6 36m) SR: 90.32

dismissalComment.html: Sri Lanka win by 132 runs! Full delivery outside off stump that pitches and moves away. Omarzai is trying to smash this into the ocean but loses his shape completely. He slices it off the outer half of the bat and long off settles under it, completing the catch with the minimal of fuss!
